sub_title: Health Systems Strengthening Consultant at Abyrint
summary:
I currently work as an independent consultant in the field of public health in developing countries, with a special interest in conflict and post-conflict settings. I have a range of interests but my passion is capacity building, which I have enjoyed doing formally since 2002. In addition, I have managed projects, conducted evaluations, advised on policy, written proposals for a wide variety of donors, and was involved in monitoring and evaluation of a number of health systems and disease control projects. I have written book chapters, articles, extensive survey reports, research reports and even set up websites. As a result of my diverse interest and experiences, I have built up a network of friends, colleagues, and professional contacts that keeps me happy and motivated. 

I love connecting people and ideas, and thinking outside the box to come up with creative solutions to problems
I can look at issues from many different perspectives due to my diverse work experience, which includes academia, humanitarian field work, UN technical assistance, advisor to health ministries, project/programme management, evaluation, and teaching/training. 
I am a communicator and an optimist, and I enjoy initiating, motivating and stimulating ideas and discussions involving a diverse audience. 
I am by nature curious, and enjoy reading, learning, meeting new people, travelling off the beaten path, and international cuisine.
My motivators are people, nature, diversity, honesty and harmony.

I can be contacted directly for short-term and longer-term consultancy work in public health, and am willing to travel internationally.

profile_positions.description:
Supporting the Federal Ministry of Health of Somalia to strengthen their COVID-19 response by
- Assisting with the preparation of proposals
- Providing guidance for the development of the new National COVID-19 Preparedness and Response Plan
- Supporting the Operations Support and Logistics consultant with the OSL assessment
- Supporting the National Institute of Health team with other activities as requested
profile_positions.title: Health Systems Strengthening Consultant

company.name: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

profile_positions.location: London, United Kingdom and Kabul, Afghanistan
profile_positions.company: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine, U. of London
profile_positions.description:
Research and dissemination of research findings
Wrote proposals and research papers on infectious diseases research, including supplementary proposals for a large Randomised Controlled Trial in Afghanistan and a Health Systems Research project. Successful track record in securing teaching and research funding. 
Organised weekly Round Table meetings in the Afghan MoPH to promote dissemination of local research findings. Member of the Afghan MoPH's Institutional Review Board and technical advisor for committee responsible for reviewing Afghanistan's Health Information Systems, as well as TA for a number of proposal review committees for MoPH, Kabul Medical University. 
Completed a "Good Practice Paper" and a dossier for the Eldis website on "Health and Fragile States" for the Health & Fragile States Network. 

Distance Learning: 
MSc Public Health: July 2009-July 2010: Distance Learning Tutor Coordinator.
Supervision of student projects; tutoring the modules "Control of Infectious Diseases" and "Issues in Public Health". Deputy Module Organiser on "Introduction to Epidemiology". Developed and Organized  the module "Conflict & Health", currently still tutoring it.
MSc Infectious Diseases: (Deputy) Module Organiser for the module "Introduction to Public Health and Control of Infectious Diseases" from 2002-2012.

Course Facilitator, Afghan Public Health Course. Based in Afghanistan for 2 1/2 years with the Ministry of Public Health in Kabul, Afghanistan. Teaching and organising lectures for a 1-year postgraduate course in Public Health taught to central Ministry of Public Health staff. Subjects taught include epidemiology, statistics, health policy, health care financing, health systems management. In addition to this course, responsible for organising and giving trainings and workshops on Research Skills, Mental Health in Fragile States and Post-Conflict situations, Organisation and Management of Mental Health Services, Disease Early Warning Systems.
profile_positions.title: (Distance Learning) Lecturer

company.name: Office of the UN Resident Coordinator in Tanzania

profile_positions.company: Office of the UN Resident Coordinator in Tanzania
profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the Duty of Care of the United Nations staff and dependents in Tanzania
- Secretary of the UN Duty of Care Committee
- Management of the UN medical services in Tanzania (technical support, budgeting, HR management, supply chain management)
- Contributing to the set-up and implementation of the UN COVID-19 Vaccination programme in Tanzania, including training, administration, budgeting, communication, M&E, and overall project management
profile_positions.title: Health focal point

profile_positions.description:
As focal point for population movement
* Monitor and report internally and externally on health needs of internally displaced and returnee populations in Ethiopia
* Develop and implement a project addressing health for international migrants from Ethiopia
* Member of the Ethiopia chapter of the Global Migration Network

As external relations officer:
* Co-chair of the Health, Population and Nutrition Partners Group established by the DAG
* Interim Coordinator of the Mental Health and Psychosocial Services in Emergencies Technical Working Group
* Member of working groups contributing to the development of Ethiopia's UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework
* Member of the Durable Solutions Initiative Working Group
* Representing WHO at high-level coordination meetings as required/appropriate

As resource mobilization officer
* Mapping of required financial and human resources within WHO Ethiopia country office, in line with WHO's country plan and the General Programme of Work 13
* Networking with potential donors
* Actively pursuing resource mobilization opportunities, including preparing and writing concept notes and project proposals, and implementing relevant activities such as donor briefings
* Working closely with MoH, EPHI, UN agencies, NGO and academic partners to develop innovative programs that address essential health needs, and write up plans and proposals accordingly
* Line management of the communications officer

Other
* Teaching on short courses
profile_positions.title: Focal point for Migration; Resource Mobilization and External Relations Officer

profile_positions.description:
The WHO Whole of Syria (WoS) sector coordinators’ main role is to ensure a joint approach across the three Syrian health hubs in order to ensure coherence and maximize the effectiveness of the response . Four countries: Turkey, Jordan, Iraq and Syria are directly involved in the emergency response activities under the WoS approach.

I work with the WoS Health Sector / Cluster teams to provide strategic direction / oversight on issues across the affected countries / operational hubs promoting a coherent coordinated approach where appropriate and also provide technical advice to health sector / cluster partners and assist in leading a coordinated and effective WoS health sector / cluster response to Syrians affected by the crisis inside Syria together with health sector partners and with the international community. 

The WoS Health Sector / Cluster Coordinator is responsible to lead the WoS Health team who work on: 
1.	Humanitarian Programme Cycle
2.	Operational coordination
3.	Information management to support all of the above
4.	Standardization of response approaches across hubs, etc. in each sector where applicable
5.	Advocacy – agreeing on joint messages at sector and inter-sector level across hubs, where required
6.	Strategic support to hub-level sector / cluster leads – sharing of best practices, knowledge sharing between hubs, capacity building, policy advice
profile_positions.title: Health Cluster Coordinator, Whole of Syria
